Class DB

java.lang.Object
school.management.system.data.DB
public class DB extends Object
Handles database operations such as connecting, querying, inserting, and updating records.

  • Constructor Details

    • DB

      public DB()

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public static Connection connect() throws SQLException
      Establishes a connection to the SQLite database. If the database file does not exist, it will be created.
      Returns:
      A Connection object to the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
      See Also:
      • DataSource.getConnection()

    • setup

      public static void setup() throws SQLException
      Creates the database main.db if it does not exist
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • validateLogin

      public boolean validateLogin(Admin admin) throws SQLException
      Validates the user logins
      Parameters:
      admin - the user to validate
      Returns:
      true if a row is returned; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • signUp

      public void signUp(Admin newAdmin) throws SQLException
      Adds a new user, hashing their password before storage.
      Parameters:
      newAdmin - the user to add
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • addTeacher

      public void addTeacher(Teacher newTeacher) throws SQLException
      Adds a new teacher
      Parameters:
      newTeacher - the teacher to add
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

      Parameters:
      newStudent - the student to add
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • addStudentsBatch

      public void addStudentsBatch(List<Student> newStudents) throws SQLException
      Inserts a list of students into the database in a single batch operation.
      Parameters:
      newStudents - The list of students to add.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • addTeachersBatch

      public void addTeachersBatch(List<Teacher> newTeachers) throws SQLException
      Inserts a list of teachers into the database in a single batch operation.
      Parameters:
      newTeachers - The list of teachers to add.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • updateStudent

      public void updateStudent(Student student) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing student's record in the database.
      Parameters:
      student - The student object with updated information.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • updateTeacher

      public void updateTeacher(Teacher teacher) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing teacher's record in the database.
      Parameters:
      teacher - The teacher object with updated information.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • searchStudent

      public List<Student> searchStudent(String searchTerm, int option) throws SQLException
      searches through the database for a particular student
      Parameters:
      searchTerm - the term to search for
      option - the search option index
      Returns:
      a List of matching Student objects.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • searchTeacher

      public List<Teacher> searchTeacher(String searchTerm, int option) throws SQLException
      searches through the database for a particular teacher
      Parameters:
      searchTerm - the term to search for
      option - the search option index
      Returns:
      a List of matching Teacher objects.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • fetchAllStudents

      public List<Student> fetchAllStudents() throws SQLException
      Fetches all students from the database.
      Returns:
      A list of all Student objects.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • updateSubject

      Parameters:
      subject - The subject object with the updated name and correct ID.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

      Parameters:
      subjectId - The ID of the subject to delete.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • getClassNameById

      public String getClassNameById(int classId) throws SQLException
      Fetches the name of a class by its ID.
      Parameters:
      classId - The ID of the class.
      Returns:
      The name of the class, or null if not found.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • countStudentsInClass

      public int countStudentsInClass(int classId) throws SQLException
      Counts the number of students assigned to a specific class.
      Parameters:
      classId - The ID of the class.
      Returns:
      The number of students in that class.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • countAssignmentsForClass

      public int countAssignmentsForClass(int classId) throws SQLException
      Counts the number of teacher assignments for a specific class.
      Parameters:
      classId - The ID of the class.
      Returns:
      The number of assignments for that class.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • getTeacherAssignments

      public List<TeacherAssignment> getTeacherAssignments() throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Retrieves all teacher assignments, joining with teacher and subject tables to get names.
      Returns:
      A list of TeacherAssignment objects.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.
      ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver is not found.

    • addTeacherAssignment

      public void addTeacherAssignment(int teacherId, int subjectId, int classLevel) throws SQLException
      Adds a new teacher assignment to the database.
      Parameters:
      teacherId - The ID of the teacher.
      subjectId - The ID of the subject.
      classLevel - The class level for the assignment.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • deleteTeacherAssignment

      public void deleteTeacherAssignment(int assignmentId) throws SQLException
      Deletes a teacher assignment from the database.
      Parameters:
      assignmentId - The ID of the assignment to delete.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • getAssignmentsForTeacher

      public List<TeacherAssignment> getAssignmentsForTeacher(int teacherId) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Retrieves all assignments for a specific teacher.
      Parameters:
      teacherId - The ID of the teacher.
      Returns:
      A list of TeacherAssignment objects for the given teacher.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.
      ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver is not found.

    • getAssignmentsForClass

      public List<TeacherAssignment> getAssignmentsForClass(int classLevel) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Retrieves all assignments for a specific class level.
      Parameters:
      classLevel - The class level to get assignments for.
      Returns:
      A list of TeacherAssignment objects for the given class.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.
      ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver is not found.

    • deleteTch

      public void deleteTch(Teacher teacher) throws SQLException
      Deletes a teacher
      Parameters:
      teacher - the teacher to delete
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • deleteStd

      public void deleteStd(Student student) throws SQLException
      Deletes a student
      Parameters:
      student - the student to delete
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • getStudentsByClass

      public List<Student> getStudentsByClass(int classLevel) throws SQLException
      Retrieves a list of students belonging to a specific class level.
      Parameters:
      classLevel - The class level to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of Student objects.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • saveAttendance

      public void saveAttendance(List<AttendanceRecord> records) throws SQLException
      Saves a list of student attendance records to the database. It first deletes any existing records for that day to prevent duplicates.
      Parameters:
      records - The list of attendance records to save.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • getStudentPayments

      public List<Payment> getStudentPayments(int studentId) throws SQLException
      Retrieves all payment records for a specific student.
      Parameters:
      studentId - The ID of the student.
      Returns:
      A list of Payment objects.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • addStudentPayment

      public void addStudentPayment(Payment payment) throws SQLException
      Adds a new payment record for a student.
      Parameters:
      payment - The Payment object containing payment details.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • getDashboardStats

      public DashboardStats getDashboardStats() throws SQLException
      Retrieves key statistics for the dashboard from the database.
      Returns:
      A DashboardStats object containing the calculated statistics.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • getStudentCountPerClassName

      public Map<String,Integer> getStudentCountPerClassName() throws SQLException
      Gets the count of students for each class, using class names.
      Returns:
      A map where the key is the class name and the value is the student count.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • getStudentGenderDistribution

      public Map<String,Integer> getStudentGenderDistribution() throws SQLException
      Gets the distribution of students by gender.
      Returns:
      A map where the key is the gender and the value is the student count.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • getFeesCollectedPerMonth

      public Map<String,Double> getFeesCollectedPerMonth() throws SQLException
      Gets the total fees collected for each month.
      Returns:
      A map where the key is the month (YYYY-MM) and the value is the total amount.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • fetchAllAdmins

      public List<Admin> fetchAllAdmins() throws SQLException
      Fetches all admins from the database, excluding their passwords.
      Returns:
      A list of all Admin objects.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.

    • updateAdmin

      public void updateAdmin(Admin admin) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing admin's record in the database. If the password in the admin object is null or empty, it is not updated.
      Parameters:
      admin - The admin object with updated information.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • deleteAdmin

      public void deleteAdmin(int adminId) throws SQLException, IllegalStateException
      Deletes an admin from the database.
      Parameters:
      adminId - The ID of the admin to delete.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs.
      IllegalStateException - if attempting to delete the last admin.
